question: My husband is 42 and was diagnosed with Type 2 diabetes in December of 2008.  We have been following a strick diet and taking Janumet with some exercise.  We are still having trouble getting his numbers down.  He averages at 160-200 plus.  Other than that he has been diagnosed with high cholesterol and takes Lipitor.  We have had a stress test done and that came back fine.  They ordered an eco and said that the "front of his heart is not functioning at a normal level."  We have been told that a normal level is 55-65% and Shawns is working at a 50%.  They stated that it is working very slowly...??   We see a heart doctor on the 5th of Feb. but are really wondering what exactly could be wrong...  WE are new to this and are scared...do you have any suggestions or some heads up on questions we should be asking to doc.   Could this all stimulate from the diabetes?   Shawn has been so healthy up until now and this is really shaking us up. I wanted to get on the internet to see if I could look any info up on heart and the front muscle and conditions... Shawn has been fatigued and we thought it was from the high blood sugar levels.concerned wife~~Angie
title: diabetic with questionable heart problems
